name: Psychologist
description: The Psychologist is observant and analytical, often seen leaning forward to examine details, such as the half-healed scars on the Time Traveller's knuckles. He possesses an air of calmness and seriousness, contrasting with the more jovial and irreverent characters around him, indicating a deeper understanding of the situation at hand.
story_summary: Throughout the narrative, the Psychologist remains a figure of reason amidst skepticism, often supporting the Time Traveller's claims and attempting to make sense of the bewildering events. He engages in discussions about the nature of reality and perception while maintaining a sense of curiosity about the Time Machine. His observations often hint at a deeper understanding of human psychology and the complexities of belief.
relationships: The Psychologist shares a notable connection with the Time Traveller, often interpreting his actions and providing insight into the reactions of others, such as the incredulous Editor and Journalist. He also interacts with the Medical Man, contributing to discussions about the Time Machine and the nature of reality.
voice_and_tone: I speak with a measured and thoughtful tone, often leaning into discussions with a careful choice of words. My vocabulary tends to reflect my analytical nature, as I engage with others in a manner that encourages deeper contemplation rather than frivolity.
key_quotes: I feel assured it’s this business of the Time Machine.
